Issues.Title: Navbar on navbar-item:focus outline can be partially outside the view
Issues.Body:
### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.1] 
My **browser** is: Chrome
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate** I couldn't find it anywhere in the issues

### Description

When using bulma navbar component and using tab to navigate, when the focus reaches a navbar-item the outline can be displayed outside the view. This happens only if your navbar is not inside a padded area and has no margins. But for a navbar it's ususally the case. 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Add a bulma navbar without padding / margin 
2. Navigate with tab until a navbar-item get focused
3. You can see the ugly outline 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1055356/97272663-88f32680-1832-11eb-81e9-5217caa5be89.png)

Please check my stackblitz -> https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-awp5ar

### Expected behavior

I understand the outline is part of the navigator "default" style sheet but it should be taken into account. 
I would expect the outline to be fully visible. 

### Actual behavior

The outline is cut at the top / left / right / or bottom depending where it is placed
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Navbar on navbar-item:focus outline can be partially outside the view" (#3162)

Issues.Title: [Help needed] color name set in $custom-colors does not overwrite name in $colors
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.0] My **browser** is: Firefox Dev Edition I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**. ### Description The following code does not overwrite the `primary` color values set in `$colors` ([source1](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/ef1e4513fbaac9af5a82dccaa58c3f394a882540/sass/utilities/derived-variables.sass#L103), [source2]()). Is that correct or should it overwrite the `primary` color values set in `$colors`? `my-custom-variriables.scss` ``` @import '~bulma/sass/utilities/initial-variables'; @import '~bulma/sass/utilities/functions'; @import '~bulma/sass/utilities/derived-variables'; @import '~bulma/sass/utilities/mixins'; $primary: blue; $primary-invert: findColorInvert($primary); $primary-light: findLightColor($primary); $primary-dark: findDarkColor($primary); $custom-colors( 'primary': ($primary, $primary-invert, $primary-light, $primary-dark), ) ``` ### Steps to Reproduce 1. add `$custom-colors` with a custom `primary` color 2. compile your styles 3. create a test element `
Some text
` ### Expected behavior The text color is `blue`; ### Actual behavior The text color is `hsl(171, 100%, 41%)` (Bulma `$turquoise`) ## Workaround Copy the complete Bulma's `$color` after setting the variable that needs to be `// customised`: ``` $colors: mergeColorMaps( ( 'white': ($white, $black), 'black': ($black, $white), 'light': ($light, $light-invert), 'dark': ($dark, $dark-invert), 'primary': ($primary, $primary-invert, $primary-light, $primary-dark), // customised 'link': ($link, $link-invert, $link-light, $link-dark), 'info': ($info, $info-invert, $info-light, $info-dark), 'success': ($success, $success-invert, $success-light, $success-dark), 'warning': ($warning, $warning-invert, $warning-light, $warning-dark), 'danger': ($danger, $danger-invert, $danger-light, $danger-dark), // custom color copied from below to work 'new-color': ($new-color, $new-color-invert), ), $custom-colors ); // Note: This still does not compile and needs to be copied into $colors $custom-colors: ( 'new-color': ($new-color, $new-color-invert), ); ``` The same with `$shades` and `$custom-shades`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Help needed] color name set in $custom-colors does not overwrite name in $colors" (#3139)
